  • Description: Package was found on the dock with wet outer contents. Upon inspection, it was found that one of the four gallon jugs had a loose cap causing internal leakage. Package was placed into a hazmat bag, and then into a salvage drum.

item.title: Report X-2024050676
item.description:
Report X-2024050676

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-20T15:12:17+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-03
  • City: CHARLOTTE
  • State: NC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: RESPONDER NOTICED A HAZMAT PACKAGE THAT LOOKED LIKE IT WAS STAINED. NOTHING WAS LEAKING FROM THE BOTTOM OF THE PACKAGE, BUT BROUGHT IT BACK TO THE DMP FOR FURTHER PROCESSING AND NOTICED THAT ONE BOTTLE WAS CRUSHED ALLOWING SOME LIQUID TO LEAK FROM THE CAP.

item.title: Report E-2024050343
item.description:
Report E-2024050343

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-20T15:12:17+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-17
  • City: SELMA
  • State: NC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: SCHNEIDER NATIONAL BULK CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: • Our driver was doing a pump unload. They unloaded 3838 gallons before one of her hoses developed a hole (towards the end – about 6-12” from the hose fitting) and was spraying the side of her truck and the ground. • She shut down right away but by the time pressure worked off of the hoses 10-15 gallons spilled out on the ground (gravel and grass). The customer handled clean up. • Turns out her hose was past the 1 year inspection interval we require on the hoses. An inspection of the hose showed no obvious signs of deterioration and appear to be age related
